oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Prevention and Control of Epidemics of Acute Undifferentiated Diarrhea of Beef Calves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Radostits, O. M.
Acres, S. D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: management
environmental contamination
crowding
Lacombe
colostrum
Immunity
Stress
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Several different infectious agents may cause acute undifferentiated diarrhea in calves. The predominant clinical sign in all of these diseases is diarrhea; therefore, they are difficult to diagnose and differentiate from each other. Because calf diarrhea is a complex of diseases, it is difficult to control reliably. Improper management is one of the most important causes of herd problems. Thus, for prevention and control, the emphasis should be placed on management of the beef herd throughout the winter and especially at calving time.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1980; 24-31
